commentBody:
Not a fan of Law and Justice or Kaczynskis, but this is a horrible article. Technically speaking, there's nothing incorrect in it but it omits the all important context - for example, that the judicial crisis started when Citizens Platform tried to unconstitutionally appoint extra judges "in advance" (before the present judges' terms expired) because they anticipated they'd lose the election.

This is just bad reporting.

replies.commentBody: What else do you think it omits besides that?

Seems as though you skimmed through this article hoping for it to play to your own bias:

"The outgoing government had made appointments to replace five of the court’s 15 judges, who were scheduled to retire, a decision that was plainly unconstitutional with regard to two of the judges, whose term expired after that of the current Legislature. But the new Parliament simply invalidated all five choices and picked five new judges, which was an even more gross violation of the constitutional order"

This was a fact driven article that portrayed the present, complex, situation in a divided nation. The author clearly made attempts to communicate with PiS and their supporters, but he was flat out rejected by PiS....love the transparency PiS.
